control

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • control.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores all of the Piece objects on the board. It keeps track of which player has which pieces. The class can move pieces via its executeMove method, as well as allow the user to toggle turns, check for checkmate and stalemate, and print out a visual representation of the board.
    Author:
    David Parsons, Phil Plucinski

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints out the chess board. Empty spaces of the same parity are black (##), white ( ) otherwise. Non-empty space are represented by aA, where a is the color (w/b) and A is the piece (p = pawn, K = king, Q = queen, R = rook, B = bishop, N = knight).
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the chess board.

      • getTurn

        public char getTurn()
        Gets the current value of 'turn' in the current instance.
        Returns:
        current instance 'turn' field

      • toggleTurn

        public void toggleTurn()
        Toggles the current player color. Sets turn to w if b, and vice versa

      • inCheck

        public boolean inCheck(char color,
                       Piece[][] board,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Piece> whitePieces,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Piece> blackPieces)
        Iterates over every opposing color piece and determines if the king is in any of their mobilities with a clear path. If the king is capturable returns true.
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the player whose pieces are to be checked.
        board - 2D array of Pieces to be examined
        whitePieces - white Piece arrayList to be examined
        blackPieces - black Piece arrayList to be examined
        Returns:
        true if the King is in check; false otherwise

      • executeMove

        public boolean executeMove(Piece[][] board,
                           java.util.ArrayList<Piece> whitePieces,
                           java.util.ArrayList<Piece> blackPieces,
                           java.awt.Point origin,
                           java.awt.Point target,
                           char promotion)
        Performs move on piece located at origin based on its target. Checks to see if the move is valid according to the capabilities of each piece and whether the move would put the player in check.
        Parameters:
        board - 2D Piece array to be used as the reference board.
        whitePieces - ArrayList of white pieces to be referenced.
        blackPieces - ArrayList of black pieces to be referenced.
        origin - Point containing the piece to be moved.
        target - Destination Point
        promotion - char indicating the desired promotion, if applicable; ' ' otherwise
        Returns:
        true if move is legal and has been performed; false otherwise

      • checkMate

        public boolean checkMate()
        Checks to see if either player is in checkmate
        Returns:
        true if a player is checkmated; false otherwise

      • inStalemate

        public boolean inStalemate()
        Checks to see if a stalemate has occurred.
        Returns:
        true if statemate is detected; false otherwise

      • matchCanContinue

        public boolean matchCanContinue()
        Checks to see if a checkmate or stalemate has occurred.
        Returns:
        true if checkmate or stalemate has been detected; false otherwise

      • printEndState

        public void printEndState()
        Prints "The Match is over"
